website_summaries.verdict: Enhanced mat, grid, and tray system that also comes in a size suitable for large dogs.
pros: Comes with a slide-out tray with Pee-Pod liner sponge that absorbs waste, and Wee Sponge powder to offset odors
Tray is slanted to enhance drainage, and clips hold the mat in place
cons: Grass itself is not of the best quality
Some dogs did not like to jump up onto it

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My Pomeranian took to this on her first try! Overall the product is light weight and easy to put together. I agree with other reviews, the grass could be better but it is still ok. There is only 1 application of the Wee sponge in the kit so make sure you buy more of that right away. I did line the whole pan with press and seal and so far so good. I ordered the medium size.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for small dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 little Yorkies and this mat works wonderfully for them! Little bladders don't last all day when we know we will be gone... Easy clean up too! Just dump the absorbent gel and replace with a new one after rinsing down the mat. I leave the black pee container in and pour a few cups of water all over the grass mat to rinse it off when we get home. Dump the yellow liquid down the toilet or utility sink and repeat until runs clear. Usually take 3 times. When it starts to get stinky we take it outside and rinse it with the hose and let it sit in the sun to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this thing is pretty big, but the tarp did not hold to ...
customer_reviews.text: this thing is pretty big, but the tarp did not hold to the platform, as pictured, so I don't know whats up with that. it would slide off all the time when the little dogs (2 chiuahuas) jumped up to go potty on it. the poop sticks to the grass and unless you have a garage where they can go on it, with a hose nearby, I highly don't recommend. I live in an apartment and this was a horrible horrible idea.
customer_reviews.author: whitney kellen

customer_reviews.title: Best ever.
customer_reviews.text: COULDN'T BE ANY HAPPIER. All 3 of my dogs used it with no trouble. I have tried all other fancy potty pans but had no luck. This one is the winner. Got the Large,which i think is the biggest one.
customer_reviews.author: AnaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works but left a stain
customer_reviews.text: While my dog does use this and the try is filling properly I have found a urine stain under the box. The whole shape of the box 😧 Had to buy a rubber mat to go under it. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and bends. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my senior husky who is starting to have trouble going down stairs to relieve herself. Though the powder was effective in eliminating the smell, I noticed that the item leaks urine. It has also been difficult for her to use as the pad does not accommodate her weight, even though I invested in the largest size. This has resulted in a significant and noticeable dip in the middle of the synthetic grass pad. Due to poor construction and design, this was a complete waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Neilson Vo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very nicely made
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very nicely made. I'm still trying to get my dog to pee on it but I think she isn't liking the step up to pee or something. I took the grass off to get her used to the grass and she's starting to pee on that. After doing a lot of research on these, I'm glad I got this one. Even though my dog isn't used to it yet, I like the idea of it being a little higher so they don't step in their pee.
customer_reviews.author: KKrisG

customer_reviews.title: USE WITH TRAINING PAD UNDER TURF
customer_reviews.text: HERE’S how to make cleaning EASY. Use disposable training pads under the turf then remove and toss weekly. Then clean the turf with hose and dish detergent. Simple!! I know, I know....pads go in the landfill. Believe me the drainage design does NOT channel pee into the collection drawer. You just end up with nasty turf. So save the earth in other ways and use the pads!! Also, buy a potty bigger than you think you will need. Our puppy grew bigger than expected so I’m buying another potty so he has more space to widdle.
customer_reviews.author: StephanieFromErie

customer_reviews.title: The grass pad slide off easily when my dog step on/off the Petloo
customer_reviews.text: My dog won't use this. I also used the "PetSafe Skip To My Loo Attractant", but that didn't help at all. Also the clips are poorly designed, they cannot hold the grass pad tight. The grass pad slip off easily when my dog step on/off the Petloo.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Qi

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is FINALLY using this! She didn't want to for a long time since it was just more of an "emergency" area on the balcony for when I couldn't make it home on time... but she was laid-up for a week with an injury that prevented her from being able to go up and down the stairs, so was kind of forced to try it, and she did! It is nice to know she finally understands it's OK to use it if needed, and it adds a lot of peace of mind when I get home late or something. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: LJC

customer_reviews.title: Great item, expensive replacement grass
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and here is a tip... Don't spend the $35 on the replacement fake grass when it gets funky. Order a roll of PZG Premium Artificial Grass Rug w/Drainage Holes & Rubber Backing. Works just a well and you only have to cut your own squares.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fleck

customer_reviews.title: Decent product that has made our lives easier
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apt on the 28th floor but thankfully have a balcony. We put in a dog door insert and put this potty station out there. It has been a life saver, especially training a new puppy. My only complaint is that the sloped basin under the turf needs better support right by the slot where the pee drains into the drawer. After use, the turf sags to mold to the sloped basin and all the pee collects right there. They need a few raised plastic pieces in the basin to keep the turf the same height as the opposite end away from the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: mjm

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got my puppy (11 weeks old) I started training her on the pee pads. It was an easy transition to the pet loo, all I had to do was put the pads on top of the grass until she got used to it then took it away. Now she’s just over 1 year and hasn’t had an accident in months! You do need to clean it every 5 days (or more if your dog goes more or is bigger, I have a 10lb dog). If you clean it properly, you won’t smell anything. People won’t even know it’s there.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Not secured
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get this for my baby (1 year old corgi boy) but I was extremely disappointed. The box comes with some type of hooks to help you keep the grass in place but it is useless! It barely hooks onto the grass and the moment my puppy gets on, it moves out of place. My dog has already slipped and tripped all over the grass a few times. It is dangerous to have but too big of a hassle to return because of the size and I already threw away the box. I would have love a more secure hook or a better way to keep the grass in place for an energetic puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian A

customer_reviews.title: Good system. The company’s Research and Development (R&D) branch could use some more “D”,
customer_reviews.text: Our Charli took to the mat right away. It’s on a screened porch, so we have to be careful of rain filling the “pee-pan” which we use with kitty litter. We would like the grass to be just a half-inch or so larger all the way around so clips would actually work that are supposed to keep the pad in place. Better quality control might ensure each “Pet-Loo” comes with four plastic clips instead of just two like ours did. The clips don’t reach far enough inward to actually grip the grass. (If they grip one side, the other side doesn’t even come close to the edge, so additional clips wouldn’t work anyway.)
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Harrod

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a bit til he chewed it up
customer_reviews.text: Maybe for some dogs it’ll work but for my American bully pocket size he ended up chewing on it. he did urinate a couple of times on the potty loo since we took the little grass that we have in our side yard and added stamped concrete . He’s still a puppy and was urinating outside and at first we didn’t want him to urinate in the concrete but after him chewing on the grass (artificial one) we just got rid of it since he ended up peeing outside of it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: italuvrigo

customer_reviews.title: A solution for burn spots on the lawn or dogs who hate snow
customer_reviews.text: Gradually, my puppy is using this loo more and more. It is a great solution to avoid trips into the snow in winter and lawn damage the rest of the year. My only issue is that puppies chew everything and the clips do not anchor down the grass very well so I watch her carefully when she is using the loo. You need to keep a roof or cover over the loo if rain or snow is in the offing or the gel in the drawer will quickly be useless.
customer_reviews.author: NixB

customer_reviews.title: Like it - could love it with a couple of enhancements
customer_reviews.text: Great product if you can train your pet to use it. Ours is used indoors. Recommend buying a second patch of artificial grass to switch out between cleanings. Pros: -significantly reduces the need for pads, thus saving you money -easy to maintain/clean Cons: -pups enjoy tearing up the artificial grass -clips provide poor stability and are easily removed by my pups for chewing -grass/tray develops a strong odor if the they aren't cleaned properly and regularly -wish the tray had some weight or non skid bottom to keep it in place
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Use piddle pads if they’ve been trained to use them at first
customer_reviews.text: I mean it’s a dog potty, there’s going to be some odor I bought the spray. My younger dog that I got as a puppy (hes 3 now) took right to it night one. I’m currently using piddle pads on it. My leg lifter rescue who has been a nightmare for six years, just caught him on video using it!!! Day 4. I think he used it once on day two as well. I bought a small fire hydrant from porch potty also another device I liked but wouldn’t work in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Harvey

customer_reviews.title: DON’T DO IT - product doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: DON’T DO IT!!! 1. This product broke in the first week I had it. The grass falls out easily and my dog ingested the bits of plastic. I replaced the grass thinking maybe it was defective but the next one was the same. 2. The grass doesn’t fit correctly and is too short, so the clips don’t hold it in place and it slides all over. Super ineffective. 3. The grass does NOT drain and no matter how many times you clean it (and I SCRUBBED it), it will continue to spell noticeably bad. The pee smell also clings to the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Meg DC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for apartments
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our new puppy. We live on the 4th floor and so it is slightly more difficult to potty train by taking down stairs or the elevator. We have had the PetSafe Pet Loo for several weeks. We love our investment and has made potty training so much easier. We still are teaching her to outside, however the Pet Loo is fantastic for the middle of the night and early morning bathroom breaks. We highly recommend it for apartment style living!
customer_reviews.author: Jake A. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever has used this a few times now, but not without a lot of persuasion. He will not walk the six feet to use it on his own. The skip to my loo works ok, but still this is not helping us keep our puppy from peeing wherever.The foam in the drawer is useless. It does nothing to absorb the odor. I'm not happy with this expensive purchase. It sounded so great but it absolutely doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome especially if you live in an apartment. It took my dog a couple days to get use to it but he's been using it for 6 months now.. He only use it for pee!! I clean it every Saturday or Sunday because it will stink, especially in the summer!🤢
customer_reviews.author: Shine

customer_reviews.title: Approved ! Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. My dog immediately started to pee on it. I think the negative reviews here are just fake, competitors being unfair or people who are clueless about potty training. ONE TiP I have is, please buy a piece of artificial turf (weather proof). It’s thicker and heavy duty. You won’t have to replace it so often. I rinse mine every 2 days or so with water and soap.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle F

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: The fake grass slides right off the base which is VERY unstable and bends under the weight of my 80lb lab (I bought the recommended size), the flimsy plastic clips popped right off. The fake grass is very poor quality, I’m better off buying a square of the nicer stuff and throwing it on the drain pan.
customer_reviews.author: Saraphim78

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Great idea in theory, but my dog refuses to go near the thing. I even tried to train him like a puppy by moving him over it when he went to go to the bathroom, but he hates it. It’s also a little too tall for a small breed dog to get on and off it comfortably. The black pins that keep the “grass” in place pop out super easy, and the powder is pretty gross to clean. All in all, I can appreciate the idea, but it has several small issues and my dog won’t use it. Plus, it’s not something you can really send back after your dog uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Very Difficult to Get Dog to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs, unsuccessful at getting either of them to use this even once. Now it is simply an expensive 3ft x 3ft putting green sitting on my upstairs balcony. I would highly recommend NOT wasting your money on this. In theory, seems like a great solution to those living in condos or apartments, etc., but it simply does not work. Your dog will look you in the eye and give you the "WTF" face while trying to train them.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an apartment pet! I love that how it keeps everything clean. I use a pee pad underneath of the fake grass without blocking the drainage hole. I change the password once a day though to keep the plastic underneath clean. That way, I do not have to wash the whole thing too often. My puppy likes that it doesn't get saturated with pee and poo and it's always fresh. :) This is the ultimate solution for my puppy. We will continue to use it when she becomes an adult dog as well so we don't have to take her outside everytime she needs to go potty.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Y. Suh

customer_reviews.title: Not for every dog
customer_reviews.text: Worked with my dog daily and she never felt comfortable with this, so I returned it right before the return window closed. She would not climb up 5 inches off the floor to potty. I was really excited to try this - she’s very smart and learns everything fast-but climbing up onto this was a bad idea. The spray attractant, treats, nope. Did not work for her.
customer_reviews.author: Iceboxannie

customer_reviews.title: Puppies smell like ruined now
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy that my 2 puppies took to using the Pet Loo right away. We live in an apartment and I needs a place for them to go potty at night because they are a small toy breed. The problem is my puppies always smell like urine now. 😕 I have the cleaner AND was it daily as I purchased 4 Pet Loos so there is alway a clean dry one. This wasn’t an issue with regular pee pads. I returned the others but my window expired on this one sadly. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Eva Fillyaw

customer_reviews.title: Unstable Pet Potty
customer_reviews.text: The grass will NOT stay on and every time it slips off, it scares my dog enough to not want to use it again. I didn't receive any grass clips as the summary says it does. It REALLY would've helped to have a grate of some kind under the turf grass because my dog "falls" into the side with the depression/drain area. It does not lay flat the way it is pictured. It just does not seem to have the quality I'd expect for something that is this expensive. Currently, I have a plant pot to hold the grass down. Guess where the pee is going?
customer_reviews.author: Divya Jaiswal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Problems could occur if used for a large male dog who hikes to pee. Refills are expensive, $15 for 3 week supply. It would be good if a build package was offered at a discounted rate. At least a 3 month supply. The disposable liners are what makes this work while. Otherwise, similar absorbing chemicals, safe for dogs, can be purchased in 1 pound containers.
customer_reviews.author: KNIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Only purchase if your willing to add more money in purchasing a better mat.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the size and it seems durable enough, BUT, the plastic grass turned both of my dogs away from it. They refused to use it. So I have ordered a 3x3 fake grass that looks and feels like real grass from another company. Just received it today so will set it up tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Bella S

customer_reviews.title: Turf is poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My dog Has been pulling pieces of the plastic “grass” out and will eat them. It is very coarse and compacts down rather than staying more grass-like. I got him to use it once but he will not use it on his own, only if he really has to go and I put him on it. I wonder if the turf was more grass-like would he use it. An expensive unsuccessful experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Heart

customer_reviews.title: MEH!
customer_reviews.text: I don't prefer this loo. The clips do not hold the Astro turf on at all. The first use and it slid off. It's fine for potty training on a deck for just a bit. I found a better and cheaper way online however you have to build it yourself - but you can do it easy instructions and the price is cheaper than the large one on here.
customer_reviews.author: Meri Malone

customer_reviews.title: charlene.shepperd@gmail.com
customer_reviews.text: Everything is just working out fine with it. My condo is on second floor and it was too difficult to continually take here outside all the time. Now I open the door to the patio and she goes. This has been a blessing for me. Only one problem, when I opened the box it was cracked at one corner, the crack did not extend over the top edge so I used super glue to give it any strength it may need in that corner. I am so very happy to have this and it is working out wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: charlene Shepperd

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!! I live in a condo and have two frenchies, I lined under the grass area with pee pads to help speed up cleaning time, it does the job and the dogs actually use it, I did have to coax them a bit with a training spray (they have a non smelly one at petco) and kept and eye on them and praised them whenever they used it. It's been easy breezy since then.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs took to it like fish to water, I just put some of their waste on the grass and they just know to do their business. Instead of using the special absorbant powder that goes with the kit I just use kitty litter in the urine collection drawers to help mask the smell. Never regretted the purchase even though the price was $30 higher when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: hstep

customer_reviews.title: Product is great. Dogs actually use it
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. Dogs actually use it. However the clamps my dogs chewed it up after first use. Sprayed with pee attractant and dogs took to it fast. However the grass is not good better off replacing with a different artificial grass that actually allows the pee to filter rather than absorbing it all.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Works great, well designed
customer_reviews.text: We moved from a house to a high rise. We put the Pet Loo on our balcony on the 21st floor. We have a chihuahua and a Toy Poodle. They both very quickly learned to use the Pet Loo. We give them high value treats when they go. It works great and is easy to clean. It has made our transition to an apartment very easy for the dogs! We highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but needs durable grass that doesn’t shed
customer_reviews.text: My puppy pees on it when he wants but won’t poop he has been using these with the breeder that I got him from but not really feeling it with me . I love the fact that yo can’t smell anything but I don’t like the fact it’s not durable and coming apart the grass and I haven’t had it even a month yet and the clamps that came with it to hold the grass in place came bent and won’t snap
customer_reviews.author: Shanaya

customer_reviews.title: Pups love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is legit a godsend if you have puppies and are trying not to use pee pads. Easy to clean, no odor and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shredding Betty

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and under delivers
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning the mat is easy at first, but the quality of the mat is poor. There are not enough drainage holes, so water puddles on the mat. My dog then has wet paws from the water/urine when she steps off. This does not help the cause for keeping our floors and carpets clean.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J. Simons

customer_reviews.title: It can get expensive but still recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this for my tiny teacup pup. Need to figure out how to control the foul order more. You can run through the powder crystals fast and that can get expensive but I still would recommend it. At first you may need to put leaves and fresh cut grass over it until your pup gets used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonshopaholic

customer_reviews.title: HECK YES!
customer_reviews.text: We did some DIYs of something like this and what a hassle those were! $120 is well worth the value. No more headaches of my dog going inside our home, no more hour-long cleanups, and no more worry! This was probably the smartest buy I have ever made! highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J Marrero

customer_reviews.title: Love the elevated consept and pee bin
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciated having this trying to train my puppy when it snowed out!! She took right to it. I take it to the tub and spray it and empty the pee bin about 1 time a week. It can get stinky but baking soda and shampoo seems to work good.
customer_reviews.author: mixingmel

customer_reviews.title: Pee loo
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously expensive. We use this as our nighttime option at our apartment. The pee pods are only good for 2-4 days and you need to replace them. Those cost $13 for 7 pods. We bought the large for our lab, and it’s a bit small
customer_reviews.author: F.P

customer_reviews.title: Super functional
customer_reviews.text: Love this whole set up more than porch potty. I like how light it is also! The only thing that we didn't like was the urine absorber. It seems wasteful and too much of an upkeep so we just place paper towels in there or empty it every few hours. The grass does hold a pretty strong odor though.
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this product should say it's good for a large dog
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this product should say it's good for a large dog. It may be good for a medium dog but not a large one. I have a yellow lab and it's small for her. I also think you should add the training aid spray with the potty or be very clear that it should be bought as well. The grass smells like vinyl and she doesn't want to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out well for us
customer_reviews.text: Quality is pretty decent altho we had to use zip ties to keep the grass part secure. Our dog refused to use it tho, didn't even like stepping up on it. We had to return them (we got 2 because the largest they offer is still small for our 75 lb male dog with pee splatter) and they were a PAIN to ship back. Our fault we threw out the boxes they came in assuming our dog would take to it so finding large enough boxes plus schlepping them to the UPS store was a huge production. If you're unsure how your dog will like/use something like this, be forewarned and keep the box.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Better than other outdoor pee pads
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for a patio! I couldn’t imagine using it inside, it keeps the urine smell. Comes with moisture absorbing beads to absorb the urine that would work really well if using indoors but not as much outside. Worth the cost since there’s not many other options out there! Fairly good size compared to other options. There’s a smaller container that collects the urine, and i would suggest taking that out anytime the pee pad isn’t being used to avoid rain overflowing it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have received the product but never opened it. It's still sitting in my garage waiting to be used. I got the largest size for my dog (husky-shepherd mix), but it's bigger than I expected and I missed the return/exchange window for it, so I have no choice but to use it, I guess. Although, if I could exchange it, I would have gotten a medium instead of a large for my dog because It takes a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: j_21

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for apartments
customer_reviews.text: Got the large size for a small chiwawa. Hr loves the extra real estate and it reduces the chances of missing. Just sprinkle water over the grass to flush it out. I may replace the fake grass for pebbles.
customer_reviews.author: paradise

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. My medium size dog would try to stand on it and it was not stable. Because of that, he is now afraid to approach anything he has to step up onto without trepidation. I ended up throwing the thing in the trash, on bulk trash day...
customer_reviews.author: SockMonkey777

customer_reviews.title: Easy to teach your dog to use!
customer_reviews.text: To get my dog to begin using this portable potty, I collected some of my dog's urine in a cup and poured the urine all over the fake grass. I then placed my dog onto the scented portable potty. He sniffed it and figured it out after only three tries. And my dog is not the brightest! Breed: Silky Terrier; Age: 10; Weight: 11 lbs.; Portable Potty Size: Medium
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be patient and consistent
customer_reviews.text: We got a little dog and tried to teach him how to use it. He did use it, but if you want to really train your dog, need time and consistency with it It’s not the product issue, is the user problem
customer_reviews.author: Juanita robiou

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Great, my puppy no longer misses the pads because it is raised 5 inches. I replaced the turf with the K9 turf as suggested in some other comments and don’t notice much difference, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Joe (Seattle)

customer_reviews.title: For older dog, large size is best
customer_reviews.text: This product worked as promised. It took just 1 day for my senior dog to learn how to use the potty. Easy to clean, cleaning whole unit 2 times a week to prevent oder. I found that having the larger size even thought my dog is only 35lb was quite necessary for his ease and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Knier

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Best money I've ever spent! After 24 hours, my 9 week old Shih Tzu knows to go to the potty grass if we cant get outside quick enough. Easy to clean and purchased 2nd grass to use while 1st is drying. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product and idea
customer_reviews.text: Mixed review. We love the drain feature and the sponge mixture. It makes cleanup so easy. However the turf is not very well designed and slips off easily, especially for a larger dog. The clips that come with the loo don’t really work but we purchased some nuts, crews and washers and drilled a hole to secure it. It now works very well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sanitary, perfect, WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so many things to accommodate my black lab on my balcony apartment and this is so worth the money! Just don’t hesitate and do it because it’s the only this that came close to working. My dog loves it and I don’t mind cleaning it at all it’s SO SANITARY!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Idk if this really works
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to replace our old potty system which was a blow up pool with kitty litter. I've tried everything and my dog will not use the product. He stepped on it once it buckeled under him and now he wont get near the damn thing
customer_reviews.author: Richard Soltero

customer_reviews.title: Its now just taking up room
customer_reviews.text: Its now just taking up room in the garage. The dog never considered using this, we followed all the instructions. Its also somewhat flimsy and not well engineered. I don't think our medium sized dog felt safe on this thing. Good idea, very poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: A.P. Marinakos

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP & OVER PRICED
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY OVER PRICED.. I COULD MAKE THIS MYSELF. THE GRASS USED IS A JOKE. DONT BUY THIS. BUY CHEAPER VERSION. THIS SHOULD SELL FOR $40 AT MOST.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Space changed...
customer_reviews.text: Moved from a home with a doggie door to an apartment with only a small patio. It didn’t take her long to get used to this and it has truly been a lifesaver! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Tyler

customer_reviews.title: We Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We live on the fourth floor and this has helped us so much. With the pandemic this has made it safer for us as we are not going out three to four times a day. Easy to deal with and clean.
customer_reviews.author: happy2bshopping

customer_reviews.title: Top Product on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This one is totally worth the money! it keeps the urine away from the grass due to the slant and drain pan. It forces the dog to get on the grass 100% due to the 4" step up; therefore, stops the partional dropping/urine on the floor. You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shop-A-Lot

customer_reviews.title: My dog didn’t care...
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars simply because overall it’s a nicely done product, my dog just refuses to have anything to do with it... The cat, however, finds it appealing and likes to lounge on it :)
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Russian Chick

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a large breed puppy and he does get his paws wet from urinating on the turf. The clips on the sides are not too effective on holding the turf down, especially if they're jumping on or off (turf will move out of place). If you're dealing with a puppy, it may try to chew the clips off. Recommend a spare turf when cleaning the dirty one. Does stink over time. Overall, I don't think it works great for medium or large dogs. Perhaps just for small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Could use some improvements but overall good.
customer_reviews.text: Was good product but could use a few fixes fist of all slides when dog jumps off. The grass pad shifts scaring dog put large rock on corners took care of that problem also added rug tape to keep from sliding around. Have not gotten one dog to use it. My second dog uses it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Qahtani

customer_reviews.title: Overly expensive
customer_reviews.text: This was probably waste of money. My dog barely uses it due to it being wobbly (bottom is bowed out), refills for pee tray is expensive and kinda pointless. My dog is tiny but pees enough... However the pee mostly gets locked into grass pad and the smell lingers for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: Grass not good
customer_reviews.text: Our 10-month-old puppy bites and pulls out the grass, I see it lying around all over the place. I am just afraid that it might be eating some of it. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: spill

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a bit...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a little bit, my puppy would use it. Then as my puppy got older and entered the chewing phase he completely tore the grass apart. Not happy because I bought the large for $99 and now I have to buy a $45 replacement grass because the grass wasn’t held down in a better way. All it has is 4 clips that barely do anything. Basically a waste of my money. Good concept, but there are still things that need upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: Macie Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy was having a hard time potty training in an apartment but as soon as we got this he has been always perfect (it has been a couple weeks). The smell isn’t terrible but we have two grass mats that we will take turns with. We have also been using kitty liter because it is much cheaper and works the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela

customer_reviews.title: Love the size
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. I had to buy this one as I recently moved and needed a smaller mat size to fit into the available space. While the powder they provide does turn the pee into a jello like substance it does nothing for the smell. I prefer to still add a little bleach to the tray as it does a better job eliminating the odor.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: This is the best! I bought the large for my 15 pound ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! I bought the large for my 15 pound shihpoo who is 9 years old and he used it right away. I placed it in the spot inside our house where he had his accidents. I did not spray it with anything to attract him to it. No need. No pee smell and easy to clean out tray.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Correa

customer_reviews.title: Just no.
customer_reviews.text: Dog hated it. So much so that trying to train her felt like cruelty. A friend told me about a pet lawn subscription service which is expensive but worth it. Had to return this pet loo. It’s a great idea in theory, and some pets might do well with it, but not mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley D

customer_reviews.title: Best pet Loo
customer_reviews.text: This item worked for me and the the tea cups. This pet loo is great!! Every thing they said it does. Not cheap made. The pads actually work like they said it would. If you spend a bit more and get the powder that goes in tray your house won’t smell like a kennel. I hope the material they use to make this product don’t change. Now you can’t tell that I have dogs in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too tall in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this a 5 star. It's good for tall dogs. Short dogs like dachshunds don't care much for climbing up to go to the bathroom on it. Otherwise, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany E. Kosa

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: Can not get the dogs to use. Even tried the bottle of stuff they recommend to try and entice them. They know its not real grass and refuse.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Ann Albritton

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: The strong durable grass pad, took my 13 week old puppy 15 minutes to have that grass all over my dining room. The clips that are supposed to hold the grass down, lets the grass go as soon as the puppy steps on, or if you put your hand in the center. When my puppy plays near it she bumps the top off the base because there is nothing holding it on.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Mckinniss

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced for the Quality
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this item a couple days ago, and my dog does use it. My issue with the product is the quality. There needs to be a grate so the grass doesn't slump down into the depression where the pee is supposed to drain. The structure itself is made of very cheap plastic. I could imagine how this product cost over 50 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Can I get the missing pieces sent?
customer_reviews.text: Box came unsealed and was missing clamps and starter kit. I can get my dogs to stand or sit in it but they have yet to actually use the bathroom on it. I'm going to keep working on it and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Carolline

customer_reviews.title: it is a nice quality product and I will more than likely give ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog did not use this at all. But, it is a nice quality product and I will more than likely give it to a rescue group with fosters. I think if it were not as high up( meaning make it lower to the ground, my smaller dog may have went on this. But it is a nice, sturdy product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nickac1970

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, easy to clean and great for young kids to learn to take care of pets without the extra mess. Much easier than the flat models.
customer_reviews.author: SamS

customer_reviews.title: Great idea.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 for our golden retriever puppy. We lived where we had no yard and this was very handy especially teaching him to go potty. I got 2 large ones to make him feel like he had space to go cause I knew he would grow fast. Glad I did and now that he's almost 4 and we've moved to a house with a yard I've still got them. Holding up well and only bringing them out when we know well be gone all day and can't find some one to let him out to go pee. (This has only happened 1 but it nice to know we've got a back up.)
customer_reviews.author: Ange Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Best pet toilet ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this my male uses it as intended but my female keeps eating the fake grass and then pukes up chunks of it. So I had to put it away for now until she stops eating everything in sight.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Never Really Worked for Us
customer_reviews.text: In theory, I think this is a great idea. In practice, my dogs just wouldn't use it. I got up first thing in the morning with them and hung around for hours hoping for a praiseworthy event, but it seemed to kind of spook them getting up on it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: When I received it the box was either damaged or had been returned. Both my cat and dog kept sniffing the box. When I got it out it smelled I believe it had been used and returned. My dog almost seemed scared of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, not for me.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs will not go on this. I have been trying to for 2 months to get them to go on it, but they are not down with it. I even bought the scent attracted spray and they could care less. The product itself is sturdy and well made. I have no complaints there. But the 'natural instinct' that dogs will go on the fake grass...is not true.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: The pet loo itself is a great product and I'd recommend it for those who are ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. We're trying to retrain our dog from going outside to the pet loo. It's not working very well. The pet loo itself is a great product and I'd recommend it for those who are training their puppies to go potty in a certain spot indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs wouldn't use it, so money down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: Nope--dogs ignored it no matter how many times we put them on it. Was pretty good quality base, but the grass was cheap plastic junk. Went right into the trash. We found a better grass patch on Amazon that they immediately used.
customer_reviews.author: luvmovies

customer_reviews.title: No smell and looks great under cabinet in bathroom
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I used parts of this and another system to make it perfect! Since the Loo is close to my toilet so I empty it once a day and don’t have any smell. I also use the other system to keep the urine neutralized ! I also used the turf of the other system! I absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Apartment Balcony
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for apartment living. Recommend putting it somewhere you have some drainage or run off isn't a problem. I have this setup on my balcony for my 50lb. boxer to use. I use the cleaning wee spray in between washes/rinses. Only con is that when it rains the pee pod WILL overflow... so you have to change it more frequently OR just don't have it in during Rainy Days.
customer_reviews.author: LilLysie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and is aesthetically pleasing. My dog took a couple of days to get used to it, but I love how easy it is to clean up. The reasons why I only give it 4 stars is because I wish they made a bigger size for the large. I have a 15 lb Maltese and there’s not very much room for him to smell/find his spot. Also, the grass is kind of cheap. However, I still like it and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Luong

customer_reviews.title: Not the Quality I Hoped For...
customer_reviews.text: The quality is not great, the product "base" feels flimsy and the "tray" does NOT fit correctly. Poor construction/quality and the fact that I could have built my own box and put a better grade of grass on top by making a visit to a local hardware store is disheartening. Sorry, but I can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Buy and its Genius!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is genius, with proppwr introducruob and tasty treats it took a week to get my dog to use, she's a large dog and I was hesitant but had no choice we bought an upper unit condo and I wanted something she could use on the outside deck for convinevce and this was it! I highly recommend with propped intro and cleaning routine is say this is a Hit.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolanxenie

customer_reviews.title: Worked for the apartment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog to use an apartment balcony. Only bad thing was when it rained it overflowed and the apartment complex didn't seem too keen on it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Roensch

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I have a small yard and this perfect for my Maltese. It is easy to clean. I just take the grass off and spray it down every other week. I like the catch tray for the pee, very easy to clean. As for the smell, I leave it outside and spray the grass frequently so it is not that bad. I left this indoor then it may become a problem with odor. Overall, I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: khai_t

customer_reviews.title: PetSafe Pet Loo Indoor/Outdoor Dog Potty - medium size
customer_reviews.text: After receiving this item, I immediately decided to return it. It is very cheaply made and extremely overpriced at $89.95. There is absolutely nothing in the quality of the materials that justifies the cost of the item.
customer_reviews.author: pks

product_meta.title: PetSafe Pet Loo Portable Indoor/Outdoor Dog Potty, Alternative to Puppy Pads, 3 Size Options for Small, Medium and Large Breeds
product_meta.description:
Size:Large

"

The PetSafe Pet Loo is the perfect solution for busy or urban pet parents. This portable indoor/outdoor toilet works for dogs, cats and small pets. The Pet Loo is a convenient alternative to pee pads. No more coming home for lunch or rushing home after work to let your pup out. Train your pet to potty inside! The urine conveniently drains through the grass mat into the Pee Pod and the Wee Sponge powder absorbs the liquid on contact to trap odors and help make clean-up easy. Use PetSafe Wee Care Enzyme Cleaner to spray on the Pet Loo grass and base to help keep your Pet Loo smelling fresh. Available in 3 sizes for small to large breeds. Remove the grass and wash down the entire unit with a hose, shower, or sink sprayer. Allow it to dry completely. Never put your Pet Loo in a washer or dryer or use chemical cleaners on the grass 

Included in the Box

 * Pet Loo Base
 * Grass Pad
 * Waste Container
 * Disposable Pee Pod
 * Trial Size Wee Sponge
